decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed two-storey side extension by reason of bulk, scale and design would constitute an obtrusive and incongruous form of development that would fail to reflect the design or complement the bulk and proportions of the original building to the detriment of the appearance of the host dwelling. The proposal would be contrary to London Plan policies D3 and D4, policies DMD2 and DMD3 of the SPP 2014 and CS14 of the LBM Core Strategy 2011.

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description:
ERECTION OF A TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION WITH GABLE ROOF, SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION, REAR ROOF 
EXTENSION AND ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING AND SWIMMING POOL IN THE REAR GARDEN AND 
INSTALLATION OF SOLAR PANELS ON THE REAR ROOF EXTENSION FLAT ROOF.
